metadata.title: CVE-2017-2899 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An exploitable integer overflow exists in the TIFF loading functionality ofthe Blender open-source 3d creation suite version 2.78c. A speciallycrafted '.tif' file can cause an integer overflow resulting in a bufferoverflow which can allow for code execution under the context of theapplication. An attacker can convince a user to use the file as an assetvia the sequencer in order to trigger this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2899` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

blender - 2.79+dfsg0-1
blender-data - 2.79+dfsg0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: blender package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.79+dfsg0-1').
